Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

abstract.p: Forrester Research Inc reports that Napster and file-sharing services like it are here to stay; says consumers will use any means necessary to gain access to content like music (S)

block.p: Napster, the controversial start-up, says its file-sharing service lets Internet users swap music online. The record companies says it facilitates theft. But a report released yesterday by Forrester Research suggests the whole debate is moot, concluding that the one certainty about Napster, and services like it, is that they are here to stay. In the report, Forrester concludes that consumers will use any means necessary to gain access to content like music. The firm asserts that if the industry tries to combat file-sharing services like Napster by encrypting music files or by filing copyright infringement lawsuits, consumers will find other ways to trade files online.
